Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Pastor Yolanda Batts, spiritual leader at Celebration Spiritual Center located at 1360 Fulton Street, 5th Floor, Brooklyn, NY 11216.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Cornegy.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Pastor Yolanda Batts, serving as spiritual leader at Celebration Spiritual Center located at 1360 Fulton Street, 5th Floor, Brooklyn, NY 11216.

Council Member Cornegy moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor – Pursuant to the authority vested in me as Mayor, and following your nomination by New York City Council Speaker Corey Johnson, I hereby appoint Mr. Anthony Perez as a Member of the New York City Economic Development Corporation (NYCEDC).
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Mr. Anthony Perez, Member of the NYC Economic Development.

Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York City Department of Sanitation and the Department of Parks and Recreation to continue to engage and collaborate with local communities to encourage and allow community composting to be carried out on parkland that is safe for residents.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: NYC Dept of Sanitation and the Dep of Parks and Recreation to continue to engage and collaborate with local communities to encourage and allow community composting to be carried out on parkland that is safe for residents.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting on surveillance data
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Reporting on surveillance data.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Congress to pass, and the President to sign, legislation requiring that any public housing development undergoing the Rental Assistance Demonstration Program (RAD) conversion to include as part of the conversion process, a full vote of all tenants in the respective public housing development at the end of a robust resident outreach process, with a majority of tenants favorably approving, in order for the conversion to move forward
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Housing
Items.MatterName: Rental Assistance Demonstration Program (RAD)

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women and Gender Equity
Items.MatterName: Advancing gender, racial, sexual orientation and income equity.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A.9041-A/S.7231-A, in relation to requiring the recording of mezzanine debt and preferred equity investments and including them in the mortgage recording tax.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Requiring the recording of mezzanine debt and including mezzanine debt in the mortgage recording tax. (A.9041-A/S.7231-A)

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader (Council Member Cumbo) presiding as the Acting President Pro Tempore

The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo).

There were 46 Council Members marked present at this virtual Stated Meeting.

At the time of this virtual Stated Meeting, there were three vacant seats in the Council pending the swearing-in of the certified winners of the following respective elections: December 22, 2020 special non-partisan election in the 12th District (The Bronx); February 2, 2021 special non-partisan election in the 24th District (Queens); February 23, 2021 special non-partisan election in the 31st District (Queens).

Items.Title: Application No. C 200155 HAK (DeKalb Commons) submitted by the Department of Housing Preservation and Development (HPD) pursuant to Article 16 of the General Municipal Law of New York State for the designation of an Urban Development Action Area and Urban Development Action Area Project for such area, and pursuant to Section 197-c of the New York City Charter for the disposition of such property to a developer to be selected by HPD, for property located at 633-639 DeKalb Avenue (Block 1774, Lots 74, 75, 76 and 77), 648-654 DeKalb Avenue (Block 1779, Lots 22, 24 and 26), 1187 Fulton Street (Block 2000, Lot 43), Borough of Brooklyn, Community District 3, Council District 36.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Landmarks, DeKalb Commons, Brooklyn (C 200155 HAK)

Items.Title: Application No. 20215007 HIQ (N 210188 HIQ) submitted pursuant to Section 3020 of the New York City Charter and Section 25-303 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York for approval of the by the Landmarks Preservation Commission’s designation of Public School 48 (now P75Q at P.S. 48, The Robert E. Peary School) (Tax Map Block 10144, Lot 42), as an historic landmark (DL-519/LP-2646), Borough of Queens, Council District 28, Community District 12.

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

M-264 & Res. No. 1522, 45-1-0 - Negative: CM Van Bramer.
M-265 & Res. No. 1523, 45-1-0 - Negative: CM Van Bramer.
M-266 & Res. No. 1524, 45-1-0 - Negative: CM Van Bramer.
M-269  & Res. No. 1513, 40-6-0 - Negative: CMs Barron, Lander, Menchaca, Kallos, Reynoso, Van Bramer.
M-270 & Res. No. 1514,  42-4-0 - Negative: CMs Barron, Menchaca, Kallos, Van Bramer.
Int. No. 1396-A, 40-6-0 - Negative: CMs Borelli, Deutsch, Gjonaj, Ulrich, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo).
Int. No. 1415-A, 39-7-0 - Negative: CMs Borelli, Deutsch, Gjonaj, Ulrich, Vallone, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo).
Int. No. 2187,  44-0-2 - Abstain: CMs Deutsch, Yeger.
Res. No. 1445-A,  45-1-0 - Negative: CM Miller.
LU No. 696 & Res. No. 1525, 44-2-0 - Negative: CMs Barron and Menchaca.
LU No. 697 & Res. No. 1526, 44-2-0 - Negative: CMs Barron and Menchaca.
LU No. 698 & Res. No. 1527, 44-2-0 - Negative: CMs Barron and Menchaca.

See files for individual votes.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Johnson) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Johnson), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) adjourned these proceedings to meet again next year for the Charter Meeting.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
